meaning: Rama, the son of Dasharatha, was virtuous, truthful, courageous, and firmly established in Dharma.
Upholding the word of one’s father is considered the highest Dharma.

sanskrit: सत्यं धर्मः परो लोके सत्ये धर्मः प्रतिष्ठितः ।
meaning: Truth is the supreme Dharma in this world; Dharma itself is established upon truth.
One should renounce desire and material gain and always remember Dharma.

sanskrit: अनृतं न वदेत् किञ्चित् धर्मे स्थित्वा नरः सदा ।
meaning: A person established in Dharma should never speak falsehood.
For the welfare of all beings, one should always act according to Dharma.
Dharma should never be abandoned, whether in happiness or sorrow.

sanskrit: धर्मेण राज्यं कुरुते स राजा सुखमेधते ।
meaning: A king who rules according to Dharma ensures happiness and prosperity.
Rama was well-versed in Dharma, educated, and compassionate towards all beings.
One should protect one’s life, but never abandon Dharma for the sake of life.

sanskrit: धर्म एव हतो हन्ति धर्मो रक्षति रक्षितः ।
meaning: Dharma destroys those who violate it and protects those who uphold it.
Rama never abandoned Dharma even when overcome by anger.
Non-violence is the highest Dharma and is beneficial for all beings.
Contentment is the greatest happiness, rooted in Dharma.

sanskrit: धैर्यं धर्मस्य मूलं स्यात् सर्वकार्येषु शोभनम् ।
meaning: Patience is the foundation of Dharma and brings excellence in all actions.

sanskrit: क्षमा धर्मस्य भूषणं वीराणां च विशेषतः ।
meaning: Forgiveness is the ornament of Dharma, especially for the strong.

sanskrit: धर्मात् न विचलत्येव यः स पन्थाः सनातनः ।
meaning: The eternal path is the one that never deviates from Dharma.
A ruler must protect his people by governing strictly according to Dharma.
